channel.title: [Help Please]Environmental Variables - Classpath
channel.description:
Ok have set my classpath and path, I can now Run my server, but can't compile it.
This is my path; [code]C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\bin;[/code] And i think that's the one that made my 'Runserver' work, I'm now looking to get the classpath working?
It's currently this; [code].;C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\ext\QTJava.zip[/code]
But when i go to that destination, i cant find the QTJava.zip
Any help please, [i]~God Of Love[/i]

item.title: [Help Please]Environmental Variables - Classpath
item.dc:creator: @whymeman whymeman
item.description:
@whymeman wrote:

ya the complier…or rty my favorite complier

@echo off
title server name goes here
color 0c

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now compiling server name goes here…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

javac -g:none -nowarn -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java

echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------
echo /
echo / Now starting server name goes here…
echo /
echo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------

java -Xmx512m -cp .;./Class; server
pause

item.title: [Help Please]Environmental Variables - Classpath
item.dc:creator: @whymeman whymeman
item.description:
@whymeman wrote:

Ha Ha Ha…
thats a good one.

Erm…
Well it depends. What java u have? I will use an example. Lets say i had java jdk 6.0…
Folow!!!
Start.
http://www.helpwithpcs.com/courses/windows-xp-tutorial/start-menu.gif

then click my computer
http://www.microsoft.com/library/media/1033/windowsxp/images/using/setup/maintain/67421-click-my-computer.gif

Then click ‘view system information’ in the top left panel

Then click on advanced
http://pure-essence.net/stuff/work/myComputerSpecs.png

on the bottom click ‘environment variables’
http://www.cs.usask.ca/~wew036/latex/env-env.jpg

then click ‘new’ on the top panel
http://www.7three.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/2008/01/environment-variables-full.gif

Then type in ‘Path’ in the first entry box… Then type in ‘C:Windows\System32;"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin’ for the second entry box… Obviously replace jdk1.6.0 with ur java. like jdk1.6.0_12\dhfdfhdfhj
now press ok.

do the same thing with the second panel…Click new and you do do the same thing…

Now time for classpath. Go to fist panel and click new… In first entry box type in ‘CLASSPATH’ then in the second box type in
C:Windows\System32;"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\ …
press ok.
Now do the same thing to the bottom panel and you r good!!!
Make sure u replace wit wateva jdk u have like. jdk1.6.0_13[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 17, 2009, 05:52:14 pm[/size][hr]hA HA DID THIS HELP?

mOPARSCAPE rULZ!!!

Read full topic

item.title: [Help Please]Environmental Variables - Classpath
item.dc:creator: @God_Of_Love God Of Love
item.description:
@God_Of_Love wrote:

Ok have set my classpath and path, I can now Run my server, but can’t compile it.

This is my path;

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\bin;

And i think that’s the one that made my ‘Runserver’ work, I’m now looking to get the classpath working?

It’s currently this;

.;C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\ext\QTJava.zip

But when i go to that destination, i cant find the QTJava.zip

Any help please,
~God Of Love
